N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 304.13 - Correspondence

State Regulations
(a) Each inmate shall be permitted to send and to receive privileged and regular
correspondence, in accordance with Parts 721, "Privileged Correspondence,"and
720, "Inmate Correspondence Program," of this Title. The inmate's ability to
send or receive correspondence may not be limited by a deprivation
order. (b) An inmate may at any
reasonable time address a written communication to the superintendent or the
commissioner. When an inmate makes a request for permission to write such a
communication, the responsible employee to whom the request is made shall: supply the inmate with necessary writing materials and an envelope; allow the
inmate to write his communication in privacy; and forward it promptly to the
addressee. Notes
